author: Dorothy Rabinowitz
title: ‘The Split’ Review: Breaking Up Is Hard to Do—but Entertaining
text: The theme of betrayal looms large in this ambitious series about an esteemed London firm of female attorneys, and not surprisingly—their specialty is divorce law. But in this six-part saga (creator Abi Morgan) no one is spared the pains of treachery, least of all this family of lawyers, the Defoes, consisting of three daughters and their mother, Ruth (an eloquent portrayal by Deborah Findlay), formidable head of the business. As the drama opens, Ruth is absorbing the fact of her oldest daughter Hannah’s defection to a rival...
